messages.message: @dlluncor what do you think about adding a line for our python3 project for the internal tooling python scripts? Some of those seem to be python2 as well.
hey @will not exactly sure what you mean here, could you elaborate?

Sorry, let me try again. :slightly_smiling_face: We have the spreadsheet here that tracks each service: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bKdDZPELc8noNMk1O578ZPrPIKzDj1OPPTqDHTybtDQ/edit#gid=0

part of our migration could also include our internal scripts and tools, much of which requires python2 today, for example `shared-utils/build-utils/gen_spec.py`
So I was wondering if you thought it might be appropriate to include those efforts in the same tracking spreadsheet
ah totally let’s do that — could you help with tracking what those tools are when you run into them?
Absolutely! I just didn’t want to go careening off on my own if it was a bad idea. haha
